name: Egyptian Equivalence Quiz | Egyptian Myth | 10 Questions

questions.text: With which creature was the God Sobek associated?
questions.explanation:
Crocodile.

	Sobek was considered a demon, a feared being that required pacification (much like the crocodile!)

questions.text: Sekhmet was a powerful deity associated with which equally powerful animal?
Ptah was one of the most revered of the Egyptian deities.  With which animal was he associated?
questions.explanation:
Bull.

	Ptah's name may also be transliterated as 'Ta-tenen' or 'Tathenen'.  That name means 'risen land'.

questions.text: Nut was a goddess who was often equated with which of these items?
questions.explanation:
Ceramic pot.

	In the Egyptian pantheon, Nut (or Nuit), the sky goddess, was paired with Geb, the earth.

questions.text: Mut was associated with which of these fearsome creatures?
questions.explanation:
Vulture.

	The name 'Mut' literally means 'mother'.  Mut essentially is the 'mother goddess of Egyptian myth, equivalent to Gaia of Greek myth.

questions.text: Which animal listed below is best associated with the god Khnum?
questions.explanation:
Ram.

	Khnum was the Egyptian god related to the Nile river's (then) unknown source.

questions.text: Khepri was a popular minor deity that found himself likened with which of these creatures?
questions.explanation:
Scarab beetle.

	Khepri was an Egyptian god associated with the movement of the sun across the sky.

questions.text: Bastet was a goddess of great importance, often depicted with the head of which animal?
questions.explanation:
Cat.

	Also known as Bast, she was one of the most ancient of the Egyptian gods.  She protected the pharaoh.

questions.text: The creator god Amun Re was sometimes associated with which of these animals?
questions.explanation:
Goose.

	Amun was the creator deity of the Heliopolitan pantheon.  Later, he came to be associated with the sun-god Re.  He was also associated with the ram.

questions.text: Horus was (and still is) one of the most well-known Egyptian gods.  Often, he is depicted with the head of which common creature?
questions.explanation:
Falcon.

	Horus was the son of Re. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you enjoyed it.
